summary: This bill, the Catastrophic Specialty Hospital Act of 2025, amends the Social Security Act to establish new payment rules under Medicare for catastrophic specialty hospitals. These hospitals, which specialize in spinal cord injury and acquired brain injury care, must meet specific criteria to qualify for this special payment system. Qualifying criteria include a high percentage of specific injury-related discharges, comprehensive care offerings, discharge volume thresholds, patient origin diversity, and demonstrated commitment to neurorehabilitation research.
